meanings.definition: The act or process of transplanting something.
meanings.sent1: The transplantations of flowers into the garden brought color and life to the yard.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had a special unit dedicated to organ transplantations.
meanings.sent3: The transplantations of ideas between friends sparked interesting conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as a transplantation, spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The transplantation of knowledge from books to young minds is crucial for learning.

meanings.sent1: After the transplantation, the plant slowly adapted to its new environment.
meanings.sent2: The transplantation of the tree was successful, and it thrived in its new home.
meanings.sent3: The transplantation of the family to a new city brought about many changes.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt a sense of transplantation as he moved to a different country.
meanings.sent5: The transplantation of traditions from one generation to the next preserves cultural heritage.

meanings.definition: The surgical procedure of transferring tissue from one part of the body to another or from one person to another.
meanings.sent1: The doctor performed a transplantation to replace the damaged kidney.
meanings.sent2: The success rate of heart transplantations has improved over the years.
meanings.sent3: During the transplantation, the patient's family waited anxiously in the waiting room.
meanings.sent4: The transplantation of skin grafts helped the burn victim heal faster.
meanings.sent5: The transplantation of bone marrow saved the patient's life.
